705819f-d.title: Brooklyn: Myrtle Avenue - Palmetto Street
705819f-d.text:
(1)
At the intersection of Myrtle Ave., with Palmetto Stree. and Wyccofh
Ave., showing (center) at the N.E. corner of Myrtle Ave., and Palmetto
Street. The 4-story building owned by the Bushwick R.R. Co., had its
offices and stables, on land owned by Peter Meserole in 1855. This
building was partly destroyed by fire on September 15, 1923. The cafe
at the right, is at the S.E. corner of Wyckoff and Myrtle Aves. To
the left is a portion of the Myrtle Ave. Elevated line of the B.M.T.
(The elevated makes a sharp turn from Myrtle Ave., into Palmetto Street
at thia point).
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2) The same, showing a closer view of the R.R. Co's building.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAr BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, showing the opposite corner occupied by the Partheno
Theatre. The theatre's site was originally part or the Ganta
Farm, which was sold for,24,000 per acre, to the Bushwick R.R. Co.,
which erected its Ridgewood Depot and stables here in 1872. This
corner while in Brooklyn in 1916, is now (1929) in Queens County.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
705819f-d.folder: Myrtle Avenue & Palmetto Street, Brooklyn, NY

707458f-a.title: Brooklyn: Wyckoff Ave. - Palmetto St.
707458f-a.text:
(1)
Wyckoff Ave., at the S.E. corner of Palmetto Street, showing the
car barns of the Brooklyn City R.R. (B.R.T.). The upper stories of the
end buildings, were cut down in 1924. (This property from 1855 to 1869,
belonged to the Troutman Estate).
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, another view. (This structure was erected in 1881).
1922
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAE BE REPRODUCED.
(3)  The same, showing the Myrtle Elevated at the right.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, showing a closer view of the upper part of the corner
building. In the background on the north side of Wyckoff Ave., is
the 2erweck Brewery.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
707458f-a.folder: Wyckoff Ave. & Palmetto St., Brooklyn, NY

corner while in Brooklyn in 1916, is now (1929) in Queens County.
